entry.title: Re: Split Valuation in SAP MM
entry.content:
Prezado Aluizio,

Primeiramente agrade√ßo sua enorme contribui√ß√£o com o tema, considerando o mercado brasileiro extremamente relevante para SAP.

Retomamos o tema desde a √∫ltima postagem e verificamos que a SAP possui uma nota em que poderemos aplicar via customiza√ß√£o a habilita√ß√£o dos campos ao menos para pedido de compra e requisi√ß√£o de compra. Vide abaixo mais detalhes:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2287838

Do ponto de vista da requisi√ß√£o, entendo que n√£o seja relevante habilitar o campo, pois a decis√£o sobre o material ser de uma determinada origem conforme a legisla√ß√£o brasileira √© no ato da emiss√£o do Pedido de Compra.

No entanto, a nota 2287838 n√£o contempla habilitar Contrato e Programa de Remessa (documentos predecessores para a gera√ß√£o de um documento de compra) onde ir√£o refletir as condi√ß√µes negociadas para um Pedido de Compra (originado de um Contrato, inclusive tipo de avalia√ß√£o, utiliza√ß√£o, origem e NCM) e Programa de Remessas para Entregas (originado de um Programa de Remessas, semelhante a um Contrato, inclusive tipo de avalia√ß√£o, utiliza√ß√£o, origem e NCM).

Objetivando o amadurecimento do tema em empresas brasileiras, pe√ßo unirmos for√ßas para redesenho destes pontos e abertura de um ticket na SAP.

entry.title: Issue/Improvement request: Chrome password manager overwrites credentials across Career Sites hosted
entry.content:
Hello SAP Support Team,

I would like to report an issue I have consistently experienced when using SAP SuccessFactors Career Sites hosted under the shared domain careerXX.sapsf.com. Please note that this message reflects my personal experience as an end user.

Context
Our company‚Äôs career site is hosted under a URL structure similar to:
https://career17.sapsf.com/

I frequently access multiple SuccessFactors career sites that are hosted under the same base domain (e.g. https://career17.sapsf.com/, https://career17.sapsf.com/) using the same email address, but with different passwords per tenant.

Observed behaviour
When I sign in on Google Chrome and Chrome offers to save the password, the credential is saved at the domain level (https://career17.sapsf.com) rather than being differentiated by the tenant path. As a result, Chrome overwrites the previously saved password for the same username/email when I log into a different tenant under the same domain. This effectively prevents me from storing multiple distinct passwords for different tenants hosted on careerXX.sapsf.com.

Impact
This leads to repeated login failures and forces frequent ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù resets when switching between different career portals, which is time-consuming and creates unnecessary friction.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Log into https://career17.sapsf.com/ using email and password A; allow Chrome to save the password.

  2. Log into https://career17.sapsf.com/ using the same email and password B; allow Chrome to save/update the password.

  3. Return to : Chrome will offer/auto-fill the credentials saved for the domain (often password B), resulting in failed authentication unless the password is reset or manually entered.

Environment

  • Browser: Google Chrome (latest stable at time of testing)

  • OS: Windows 11

  • Authentication: username/email + password

  • Hosting pattern: shared domain careerXX.sapsf.com with tenant differentiation by URL path

Request
Could you please confirm whether this is expected browser behaviour given the shared-domain, path-based tenant structure? If so, I would appreciate SAP‚Äôs recommended best practice to mitigate the issue (e.g. use of a customer-specific domain/CNAME, alternative URL strategy, or authentication approach) to avoid credential collisions in password managers.

I am happy to provide screenshots or a short screen recording if needed.

Kind regards,
Christian Jerez

entry.title: Re: Disable standard field in ME22N,ME21N
entry.content:
Prezados,

Estamos passando por uma situa√ß√£o similar na Localiza√ß√£o Brasil.

Ativamos o split valuation para in√∫meros cadastros de materiais.

Ocorre que no Brasil h√° legisla√ß√£o bem complexa, onde por exemplo o c√≥digo de origem de material (baseado a partir da CST no XML da NF-e) fica "bloqueado" para edi√ß√£o pelo emissor do Pedido de Compra, Contrato ou Programa de Remessa quando o split valuation √© ativado.

Esse tipo de bloqueio deste campo pode gerar:

- retrabalho pelo comprador, antes de emitir o documento de compra, solicitando ao time de Master Data para alterar a origem do material antes de emitir Pedido de Compra, Contrato ou Programa de Remessa;

- caso o comprador opte por emitir o documento de compra sem acionar o Master Data, o BP (Fornecedor) ir√° receber o PO e realizar o faturamento, mas poder√° haver diverg√™ncia entre PO x NF-e, portanto, nesse momento a Fatura ficar√° aguardando solicita√ß√£o do Comprador (Suprimentos) para alterar no cadastro (Master Data), ap√≥s a altera√ß√£o o Comprador (Suprimentos) elimina a linha do PO e reinsere com os dados "alterados" e reaprova o Pedido de Compra, e por √∫ltimo a fatura √© implantada no SAP;

- podemos at√© pensar em criar split para a quantidade de origens da localiza√ß√£o Brasil, mas ficaria impratic√°vel o gerenciamento, ou seja, um √∫nico material ter de 1 at√© 9 split valuations em fun√ß√£o das quantidades de origens de cada material variar. Nesse sentido, o Requisitante de Compra poder√° selecionar um split valuation com Origem "0" por exemplo, mas √© o Comprador que ap√≥s consultar diversificados Fornecedores no mercado que definir√° a melhor op√ß√£o de compra, portanto, ir√° gerar retrabalho na Requisi√ß√£o de Compra com a troca do split valuation.

- avan√ßando para o campo "Utiliza√ß√£o" que tamb√©m fica bloqueado com a ativa√ß√£o do split valuation, poderemos comprar o mesmo material para "consumo" ou para "imobilizado", portanto, seguindo a mesma l√≥gica supracitada.

Nesse sentido, identificamos a SAP 2287838, onde detalha ser poss√≠vel habilitar via customiza√ß√£o os campos para Pedido de Compra e Requisi√ß√£o de Compra, mas n√£o menciona a possibilidade de habilitar para Contrato e Programa de Remessa.

Note https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2287838

Nesse sentido, seria extremamente importante a SAP identificar oportunidades de melhoria standard para garantir que a legisla√ß√£o do Brasil seja convergida com o SAP/4Hana e utilizarmos a fun√ß√£o com seguran√ßa e garantia t√©cnica de funcionamento.

entry.title: EWM QM Serial Number Integration on S4 HANA 2025 FPS00
entry.content:
New Functionality from S4 HANA 2025 FPS00- This New feature enables to record a quality inspection result for a specific serialized product in the Quality Management (QM) component of SAP S/4HANA by recording a usage decision for the serialized product with reference to its serial number. The system copies the serial number to the inspection lot in the QM component during the goods receipt posting of the stock item.

Main Features of QM EWM Serial number Integration.

  • Valid for both Embedded and Decentral systems.
  •  Used in IOT4 and IOT5 scenarios (both Ad-Hoc and Recurring) as well as in Synchronous Posting.
  • Summary Level Inspection can happen prior to UD( Technically at time of Result recording)
  • During results recording,  Inspection results for single products with reference to their corresponding serial numbers can be recorded( Summary Level).
  • Summary level can only be invoked for Inbound delivery posting and hence not possible for Synchronous Posting.

How to Set up-

Activate serial Number integration in IOT 4 or 5 customizing( The summary level QM EWM is implicitly explained in F4)

 

Configure Serial Number Profile

Use the Procedure QMSL( Usage must be 3)

 

Master Data MM03

Activate Inspection Type 01( Embedded EWM) & 1701 in Case of Decentralized EWM on S4 with below indicator( Serial Numbers Possible for Inspection Lot)

SAP implicitly mentioning 3 things here

  1. 'Inspection Lot Summary' can be conducted even with Serial no activation 
  2. Serial number can be copied to Pre-sampling in Production scenarios
  3. Serial number is copied during GR posting( IOT 4 & IOT 5), Inbound delivery based as well Synchronous posting based.

Testing performed using MIGO( Synchronous Based)

Serial numbers are assigned to Inspection Lot QA03

Serial numbers are available at time of Result Recording QE01/QE51N( Screen shot of GR posted of 3 EA of different serial numbers than above)

 

Serial number are available at time of Usage decision( This functionality was already available from S4H 1709 onwards & 9.5)

This functionality of QM EWM Serial number integration is now exactly same like IM Based QM integration which earlier was missing.

Thanks for reading. All tests are performed in S4 HANA 2025 FPS00 Sandbox system 

References:

Help. SAP Serial Numbers in Inspection Results | SAP Help Portal

SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA ... - SAP Community

entry.title: How to enhance the ATTP on S/4HANA Fiori Apps with customized fields
entry.content:
This blog explains how to enhance the standard delivered Fiori Apps from SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals on S/4HANA by adding a appended field into the List Report and Object Page.

 

Target of the enhancement:

For an appended field (Z_CUSTOMFIELD1) in the event table (/STTP/DM_EVT):

  • Add it to the Display Events Fiori App as a Global Filter and a List Report column

  • Display it on the Object Page as well

 

Pre-requisites:

To do the same in your system, the developer is expected to have the following background:

  • Medium-level understanding of ATTP repository table structures and relationships
  • Basic ABAP Data Dictionary enhancement knowledge (appended structure, appended fields, etc.)
  • Basic to medium-level CDS View knowledge (CDS basics, VDM, view extension, etc.)
  • Medium-level Fiori annotation knowledge (List Report and Object Page annotations, metadata extension, etc.)
  • ADT (ABAP Development Tools), as most developments will be conducted there

And the enhancement will be entirely based on ABAP & CDS View & Annotations, no frontend development involved.

 

Solution in general:

For the Fiori Apps delivered in ATTP S4, their backend services were built with RAP Framework (ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model). With this framework, the OData services for the Fiori Apps are built with CDS Views providing data, and the UI annotations providing UI layouts (this is a highly abstracted summary üòÄ).

So, to enhance the Fiori Apps as we wanted, basically we need to do 2 things:

  1. Enhance the CDS views to include the appended field in the OData Service
  2. Enhance the Fiori UI Annotations to render the appended field onto the designated places in UI

 

Solution in detail:

Step 1: Enhance the CDS views to include Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 from table /STTP/DM_EVT

First, identify the related CDS views for the Display Events Fiori app. You can use the following steps:

In ADT, open the package /STTP/WEBUI. This is where the OData services for all ATTP S4 Fiori apps are located.

From the package description we can tell:

  • /STTP/EVENT_DATA_CDS contains the CDS views for the Display Events app
  • /STTP/EVENT_ODATA_SRV contains the OData service definitions

Though we are trying to find the correct CDS views to work on the enhancement, but as they are often layered and numerous, a good way is to start from the OData service definitions:

  • Open the service definitions in package /STTP/EVENT_ODATA_SRV and see which CDS views are exposed.

below are the CDS views:

  • Because the appended field is in the event table, the consumption view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT is the right candidate to enhance.
  • Ctrl+click /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT to navigate to it. You will see it projects from /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT_E:

which in turn is based on /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT

of which the base table is /STTP/DM_EVT (the event table - where the appended field was added):

 

Now we take a break and summarize the realted artifacts:

  • CDS view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT (consumption view, used directly by the OData service)
  • CDS view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT_E
  • CDS view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT (interface/base view reading from the DB table)
  • DB table /STTP/DM_EVT (the table where the appended field is added)

Because the appended field is currently only in /STTP/DM_EVT, we need to have it in all related CDS views, bottom-up:

For CDS view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT:

  • Create a View Entity Extension (new Data Definition using the extendViewEntity template)

Enter Package, Name and Description:

In the next steps, ensure you are selecting the extendViewEntity as template

  • Add the appended field Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 to the extended view and activate it

Then do the same for the view /STTP/I_DM_EVT_EVENT_E:

  • Create a similar View Entity Extension
  • Add Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 to the extended view

Also, for consumption view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT:

  • Create a View Entity Extension
  • Add Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 to the extended view

Afterwards - for verification only - run the view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT as ABAP Application to ensure the extended field is in the result columns:

At this point, Step 1 is complete: Z_CUSTOMFIELD1 is included in the CDS views and thus in the OData service.

Step 2: Make the appended field appear in the Fiori UI via annotations

Next, we will bring the field into the List Report and Object Page.

List Report:

One good news is - Since the consumption view /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT has been enhanced with the custom field, it is automatically propagated to the OData service and to the Display Events Fiori app. In the List Report, the field will be available in the global filters and as a table column (typically hidden by default).

And if you enable the filter, and use it to search with related value, it will work too:

To provide default visibility, you can add below annotation in the extension view for /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT (which you created in the previous step):

(Use the position value to control ordering among other filters and fields.)

And the result looks like the following:

 

Object Page:

Here, we need to firstly understand how existing fields are added to the Object Page. The simple answer is ‚Äì via Annotations from the Metadata Extension File for /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT. If you open that metadata extension file (search in your ADT with name /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT, select the one with file type Metadata Extension), you will find the Facet definition which is cater for the definition of Event Field Group in the Details section, and that‚Äôs where we wanted to place our custom field:

To add the custom field there:

  • Note down the ‚ÄútargetQualifier‚Äù of the target facet to be enhanced ‚Äì ‚ÄúeventInfo‚Äù,
  • Add below annotation to the extension view:

Again, use the position attribute to control where the field appears relative to other fields.

Then the Custom Field is enhanced successfully in the Object Page too, and this concludes the development.

 

Recap:

The major development work was placed at the Extension View of /STTP/C_DM_EVT_EVENT, and this is how it looks like after the development:

  • The extended field provides the data access of the appended field to the Fiori App.
  • The annotations provides how we want to display the appended field in standard Fiori App:
    • The annotation @ui.selectionField: [xxxx] enables the appened field into the global filer
    • The annotation @ui: { lineItem: [xxxx]} enables the appended field into the list table
    • The annotation @ui.fieldGroup: [xxxx] enables the appended field into the Object Page

Thanks for reading. I hope you find this blog helpful, and pls remember that there are many more Fiori annotations that you can apply and use in your project to shape the enhanced fields per your needs, like adding value helps, define text descriptions etc.

You can check the Fiori Element and UI Annotations documentations and find more. Cheers.

(END)

Èô§‰∫ÜËøÅÁßªËåÉÂõ¥ÔºåËøòÊúâËøÅÁßªÈ°∫Â∫è

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM Welcome Session | APAC | English
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Have you recently requested provisioning of SAP Cloud ALM? We are thrilled to welcome you aboard! Your journey with SAP Cloud ALM is about to begin, and we‚Äôre here to ensure it is smooth and efficient.

To assist you in this journey, we would like to invite you to the below online webinar where we‚Äôll guide you through the setup process and answer any questions you may have.

What to Expect in the Webinar

The SAP Cloud ALM Welcome Webinar has been designed to ensure that you and your team are set up for success. During the session, we will:

  • Demonstrate the initial login procedures to access your SAP Cloud ALM tenant.
  • Provide guidance on the next steps to use the solution effectively.
  • Highlight essential training resources to support you and your team‚Äôs learning journey.
  • Answer any questions you may have during the session.

Your Next Steps

To make the most of your SAP Cloud ALM onboarding experience, here‚Äôs what you need to do:

  1. Share this information with your key stakeholders.

    • Ensure that IT Admins, Project Leads, and Implementation or Operations Partners responsible for SAP Cloud ALM are informed.
    • Don‚Äôt forget to forward the webinar invitation to your project implementation partner for their participation.

  2. Register for the Webinar.
    Register Now

We‚Äôre excited to embark on this journey with you! Let‚Äôs make the most of SAP Cloud ALM together. See you at the webinar!

entry.title: Utilizing Employee Central Quick Actions to support Internal hires with Onboarding
entry.content:
In this article we will discuss a specific requirement from a customer for their internal moves within the same legal entity and whether onboarding is needed to deliver the desired business results.

In this specific scenario an employee moves within the same legal entity.  The customer would like the employee to check that their home address is accurate, they do not need to sign any new forms, nor do they need any onboarding tasks completed.  The customer thought they should configure the following.

  1. Onboarding for internal hires is initiated from SuccessFactors Recruitment.
  2. The SuccessFactors Employee Central record is updated based on the data from SuccessFactors Recruitment. 
  3. The system will trigger an 'Onboarding process' for the employee to check their data via 'Personal Data Collection'.

This is a perfectly valid process, but as the customer only wants to check the address, is this the best option?  A potential downside of this process is that unless the employee completes the process the onboarding task will remain open on the onboarding dashboard, and it is a rather complex solution to a basic requirement.  An alternative is as follows. When the SuccessFactors Employee Central record is updated, Employee Central sends an employee a custom email or alert that could say something like this.

Dear employee

As you now have a new position in the organisation, we would like you to double check that your home address is still correct.  The first line of your address in the system is ‚ÄòXXXX‚Äô, if this is still correct then you do not need to do anything else.

If the address is incorrect then please log into the system and click on the ‚ÄòManage My Data‚Äô icon and click on ‚ÄòChange Address‚Äô

Many Thanks

This is what it looks like in SuccessFactors Employee Central

 

This process utilizes the 'quick action cards' and means that we are not using onboarding for this process.  All workflow and permissions are respected when they make an update.

If the requirement also needed some onboarding tasks, you could still trigger this process and have onboarding tasks created via onboarding.  However, if you want the employee to sign documents then you would clearly utilize a full onboarding process.

Hopefully this article provides an insight into the potential flexibility of SuccessFactors Onboarding & Employee Central for certain internal hires scenarios.

entry.title: Is it possible to limit to special files in RAG
entry.content:
Hi,Expert, 

We can integrate Object store or SharePoint Site into AI Core , then we can use RAG . If there end user raise a query to AI Core.  Then AI Core can answer the query based files in object tore and SharePoint . But we need AI Core answer the query based on specified files . Is this technical requirements possible ?

You may ask why ?  For example,  customer need to develop a solution to evaluate the projects Auction/BID intelligently . Every project have requirements in files in PDF WORD, EXCEL. Every vendor will  submit fills in PDF WORD EXCEL as a BID . Then AI Core need evaluate  based on specific project's files and BIDs' files from vendor.

You may suggest to use HANA vector , then the question is why customer need to store the files multiple times which will increase cost .  And the since the files are in different types.  Can one splitter can cove all these files types ? The situation become more complicated .

Your suggestions and discussions are welcomed!

Best Regards!

Jacky Liu

entry.title: Successfactors - Custom MDF - Unique Identifier
entry.content:
Hi All,

We require a system-generated unique identifier for each record created in a custom MDF object related to Travel. This identifier must be assigned only at the time of record creation and must remain unchanged during subsequent edits or workflow updates. We explored multiple approaches but encountered the following limitations:

  1. A Save Rule was implemented at the object level, using a custom field to store the identifier. However, this resulted in the identifier being regenerated on every record edit or upon workflow completion.

  2. UI Rules were evaluated, but they do not support the generation of sequential or system-controlled unique identifiers.

  3. The externalCode field was configured as a String to manually control the identifier; however, this prevented the object from being associated with the Latest People Profile.

Seeking expert advise to handle this scenario.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Payment Block Not Transferred to AR Line Item from Billing Document in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are facing an issue with payment block transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Issue Description:

When we create a billing document with a payment term that has a payment block setting, the payment block is not transferred to the AR line item of the automatically posted accounting document.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Created a payment term with payment block reason (e.g., `A` - All items)
2. Created a sales order using this payment term
3. Created a billing document (VF01) referring to the sales order
4. Checked the accounting document posted automatically from the billing document
5. Result: Payment block is missing in the AR line item (Customer line)

Expected Behavior:

The payment block should be transferred from the payment term to the AR line item, so that the invoice is excluded from automatic payment runs.

On-Premise Solution:

In S/4HANA On-Premise, SAP Note 132701 instructs us to implement a User Exit to transfer the payment block from billing document to accounting document.

Question:

How can we achieve this in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

- Is there a standard configuration to enable this?
- Should we use a specific Business Add-In (BAdI)?
- Is there a custom logic app or extension required?
- Are there any SAP Notes or best practices for this scenario in Public Cloud?

Environment:

- SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (latest release)
- Activated scope items: 1G1 (Sell from Stock), BDG (Accounts Receivable)

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: how to setup resource group in the Joule Agent Builder
entry.content:
Yes, the way adding Documents to Joule Agent recently changed.

The idea now is that an admin will enable different Document collections in the Control Tower, and make them available to developers. It seems soon they will also allow admins to specify the environments that each document collection can be used in.

Then the developers will be able to add documents to their agents without having to do the work of setting them up. 

  • According to documentation, you must have AI Core and Object Store (I assume in the future you can have other document repositories): https://help.sap.com/docs/Joule_Studio/45f9d2b8914b4f0ba731570ff9a85313/626498be11064953810a852535900ca7.html?locale=en-US
  • You can set up Document Grounding in AI Core to use SharePoint, and there were TechEd sessions on how to do that. But these pipelines as far as I know cannot currently be used in Joule Agents.

entry.title: Re: Price is not getting populated in components tab of w...
entry.content:
To your question "price will be picked from material and Planning Plant combination or the plant assigned in component line for material combination", the price is picked from the plant assigned in the component line, not from the order‚Äôs planning plant. In other words if your work order is created in Planning Plant YYYY, but the component line specifies Plant XXXX, the system will look at Material 1234 in Plant XXXX for valuation. This is why the MAP of 100 in Plant XXXX should be used ‚Äî but if valuation variant config is missing or incorrect, it defaults to zero.

Check the below areas:

Go to OKP8 ‚Üí Material Valuation tab. Ensure one of the strategies includes Moving Average Price or Price according to price control in material master. Example Strategy sequence could be Planned price 1 / Moving Average Price / Standard Price

Confirm that Material 1234 has MAP maintained in Plant XXXX. Check if the material is flagged as non-valuated or has special procurement that bypasses valuation.

Ensure the correct costing variant is assigned to your order type. The costing variant links to the valuation variant, so if the wrong one is assigned, MAP won‚Äôt be picked.

entry.title: Rename user identity (username) in Cloud ALM (BTP)
entry.content:
Hello,

We have been using Cloud Identity Service (CIS) for several years and have set it up as the identity provider for our Cloud ALM. 
Unfortunately, we created the user names in the wrong format at the time, which now confronts us with a major challenge. 
A corporate identity provider (Entra ID) is used behind the Cloud Identity Service. We would now like to use several corporate identity providers and/or the internal user store from CIS in addition. Unfortunately, we no longer have the option of setting up conditional authentication with the users we have already created, as the domain does not exist in the user name.

Is there a way to change the user names without deleting and recreating them in Cloud ALM / BTP? We are talking about ~400 users here. Because when I change a user in Cloud ALM (or BTP) to a new user, the assigned objects in Cloud ALM disappear from that user. When I change the attribute in the corporate IdP, a new user is created.

Current format of the USERNAME />Desired format of the USERNAME

The problem would also arise if a company changed the domain and the user names (domain) had to be changed.

Can you help us with this?

Best regards,


--- Support Assistant ---

entry.title: Re: Rename user identity (username) in Cloud ALM (BTP)
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Greetings from SAP Support.

Although the user name cannot be changed directly in SAP Cloud ALM, you can edit user first name and last name in SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS).

After making the change, please log out and log in again to the SAP Cloud ALM tenant to ensure the update is reflected.

After the next daily synchronization job, the updated name will also be reflected in Cloud ALM BTP Subaccount.

3609235 - Details on the synchronization of data between Cloud ALM BTP Subaccount and Cloud ALM tenant - SAP for Me

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Readiness check report not showing for S4hana 2025
entry.content:
The product version can be selected in the Readiness Check is depends on the Simplification Item Catalog (SI Catalog) as well as the current product version installed on the system.
To update the latest version of the SI Catalog:

  1. Apply the latest version of the note 2399707
  2. The SI Content can be updated via SE38 -> Run the report "/SDF/RC_START_CHECK" -> Update catalog with Latest version from SAP, then it will automatically update the SI catalog via the SAP-SUPPORT_PORTAL destination to SAP backend.
  3. It is also possible to manually download the SI Content from https://me.sap.com/sic, then upload it via the report "/sdf/rc_start_check"

entry.title: Re: Payment Block Not Transferred to AR Line Item from Bi...
entry.content:
Payment terms in Cloud only control due dates and cash discount conditions. The payment block field in AR line items is independent and not linked by default to payment terms. In on‚Äëpremise, you could enhance the transfer logic with a user exit. In Public Cloud, user exits are not available ‚Äî only released BAdIs and custom logic.

So the recommendation is implement a custom logic enhancement in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using the released BAdI for AR line item posting. This will allow you to replicate the on‚Äëpremise behavior: transfer the payment block from payment term to AR line item.

entry.title: Re: About SAP Cloud ALM roles
entry.content:
To add to this, there are also scenarios where the "Cross Global Administrator" will not be sufficient to manage everything.

The "Cross Global Administrator" Role Collection will grant authorizations for all functionality both owned by and executed by SAP Cloud ALM itself. For scenarios where SAP Cloud ALM acts as a trigger to execute functionality within other products, the Cross Global Administrator Role Collection will not contain the additional specific roles related to that functionality. The Role Collections specific to those functionalities within other products will need to be assigned to any user that is expected to work with them. These scenarios currently include:

  • Integrating the Cloud Integration Automation Service
  • Enabling Transport Management - SAP Cloud Transport Management Service

entry.title: Handling Stock Split Between Bins Based on Capacity
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am working on an SAP EWM setup and need assistance with a specific stock putaway scenario.

Scenario:

  • We have 3 bins in a warehouse:

    • S001-01: 100 units capacity

    • S001-02: 100 units capacity

    • S001-03: 100 units capacity

Requirements:

  1. If we receive a batch of 100 units, the system should place the full 100 units in an empty bin (e.g., S001-01).

  2. If a bin has 50 units already and we receive another 50 units, the system should add the 50 units to the existing bin.

  3. If we receive 150 units, the system should:

    • Place 50 units in the partially filled bin (e.g., S001-01, which already has 50 units).

    • Place the remaining 100 units in another bin (e.g., S001-02).

Issue:

I have tried configuring the system, but it is not working as expected. It doesn't seem to split the stock between bins based on available space.

Questions:

  • Can this behavior be achieved through standard configuration in SAP EWM, or would it require custom enhancements (e.g., BAdIs or user exits)?

  • Are there any specific settings or strategies I should be looking into for handling capacity-based putaway and stock splitting across multiple bins?

Any help or guidance would be appreciated!

Regards,

Chand.

entry.title: Dependency for overhead and labour hours calculation, including setup time in master recipe.
entry.content:
Hi all,

I would like to create a dependency for the overhead hours and the labour hours, but I cannot quite figure out the dependency syntax.

  • I have reference characteristic LABOUR_HOURS for labour hours (PLPOD-VGW01)
  • I have a reference characteristics OVERHEAD_HOURS for overhead hours (PLPOD-VGW02).
  • I have a reference characteristic ORDER_QUANTITY that picks up the sales order quantity (VBAP-KWMENG).

The formulas always include a setup time of 1 hour, that is independent of the production quantity. If 10 pieces are produced, the setup is 1 hour, if 1000 pieces are produced, the setup time is also 1 hour.

To labour hours is calculated as below: 

Total labour time is 1 + 1,5 * production quantity.

I have the following syntax:

$SELF.LABOUR_HOURS = 1 + 1,5 * $ROOT.ORDER_QUANTITY

For some reason, this syntax does not produce any results. What is wrong with this syntax?

How can I include this 1 hour of setup time in the dependency syntax? I want to prevent this 1 hour being added for every piece. For a production of 100 pieces:

Correct: 1 + 1,5*100 = 151 hours for the total production cycle.

Incorrect: 1 + 1,5*100 = 151 hours per piece produced (which it what I expect will happen with the syntax above).

Is it possible to create and use a dependency to calculate the total labour hours instead of a calculation per piece? 

What is the best approach for this?

Thanks in advance!
